question: Rapa Nui National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located in which nation?
explanation: Rapa Nui National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is located in Chile. Rapa Nui is the indigenous name of Easter Islands. It has a Polynesian origin. This boasts of unique monumental sculpture and architectural style. This site houses the famous enormous stone figures known as "moai" which stands on the ceremonial platforms known as "ahu" built during the 10th to 16th century.
